com.tingyik90.snackprogressbar

Class SnackProgressBarManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tingyik90.snackprogressbar.SnackProgressBarManager

  • public class SnackProgressBarManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manager class handling all the SnackProgressBars added. It adds a RelativeLayout on top of the current activity.

    There is only ONE instance of this layout (called "MainLayout" here). All actions of showing, hiding and updating the SnackProgressBar are reflected via this layout i.e. no new layout drawn.

    This class queues the SnackProgressBars to be shown. It will dismiss the SnackProgressBar according to its desired duration before showing the next in queue.

    • Field Detail

      • LENGTH_INDEFINITE

        public static final int LENGTH_INDEFINITE
        Show the SnackProgressBar indefinitely. Note that this will be changed to LENGTH_LONG and dismissed if there is another SnackProgressBar in queue after.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LENGTH_SHORT

        public static final int LENGTH_SHORT
        Show the SnackProgressBar for a short period of time.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LENGTH_LONG

        public static final int LENGTH_LONG
        Show the SnackProgressBar for a long period of time.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Default snackbar background color as per Material Design.

        Default message text color as per Material Design.

      • ACTION_COLOR_DEFAULT

        public static final int ACTION_COLOR_DEFAULT
        Default action text color as per Material Design i.e. R.color.colorAccent.

      • PROGRESSBAR_COLOR_DEFAULT

        public static final int PROGRESSBAR_COLOR_DEFAULT
        Default progressBar color as per Material Design i.e. R.color.colorAccent.

        Constructor

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(@NonNull
                SnackProgressBar snackProgressBar)
        Add a SnackProgressBar into SnackProgressBarManager's HashMap to perform further action. The SnackProgressBar is uniquely identified with the SnackProgressBar's id. The first SnackProgressBar will be overwritten if another SnackProgressBar with the same id is added to the list.
        Parameters:
        snackProgressBar - SnackProgressBar to be added.
        See Also:
        SnackProgressBar

      • show

        public void show(int id)
        Show the SnackProgressBar based on its id with LENGTH_INDEFINITE. If another SnackProgressBar is already showing in the MainLayout, this SnackProgressBar will be queued and shown accordingly after those queued are dismissed.
        Parameters:
        id - id of the SnackProgressBar to be shown (must be already added to HashMap).
        See Also:
        add(SnackProgressBar)

      • show

        public void show(int id,
                 long duration)
        Show the SnackProgressBar based on its id with the specified duration. If another SnackProgressBar is already showing in the MainLayout, this SnackProgressBar will be queued and shown accordingly after those queued are dismissed.
        Parameters:
        id - id of the SnackProgressBar to be shown (must be already added to HashMap).
        duration - duration to show the SnackProgressBar of either LENGTH_SHORT, LENGTH_LONG, LENGTH_INDEFINITE.
        See Also:
        add(SnackProgressBar)

      • show

        public void show(@NonNull
                 SnackProgressBar snackProgressBar)
        Show the SnackProgressBar based on its id with LENGTH_INDEFINITE. If another SnackProgressBar is already showing in the MainLayout, this SnackProgressBar will be queue and shown accordingly after those queued are dismissed.
        Parameters:
        snackProgressBar - SnackProgressBar to be shown.

      • show

        public void show(@NonNull
                 SnackProgressBar snackProgressBar,
                 long duration)
        Show the SnackProgressBar based on its id with the specified duration. If another SnackProgressBar is already showing in the MainLayout, this SnackProgressBar will be queued and shown accordingly after those queued are dismissed.
        Parameters:
        snackProgressBar - SnackProgressBar to be shown.
        duration - duration to show the SnackProgressBar of either LENGTH_SHORT, LENGTH_LONG, LENGTH_INDEFINITE.

      • updateLastShowing

        public void updateLastShowing()
        Update the last showing SnackProgressBar.

      • updateTo

        public void updateTo(int id)
        This will update the MainLayout without dismissing it e.g. updating message without animation.

        Note: This does not change the queue.

        Parameters:
        id - id of the SnackProgressBar to be updated to (must be already added to HashMap).

      • updateTo

        public void updateTo(@NonNull
                     SnackProgressBar snackProgressBar)
        This will update the MainLayout without dismissing it e.g. updating message without animation.

        Note: This does not change the queue.

        Parameters:
        snackProgressBar - SnackProgressBar to be updated to.

      • dismiss

        public void dismiss()
        Dismiss the currently showing SnackProgressBar. The next SnackProgressBar in queue will be shown.

      • clearAll

        public void clearAll()
        Clear all the SnackProgressBar that is in queue to be shown. The currently shown SnackProgressBar will also be dismissed.

      • setOnActionClickListener

        public SnackProgressBarManager setOnActionClickListener(SnackProgressBarManager.OnActionClickListener onActionClickListener)
        Attach actionClickListener.
        Parameters:
        onActionClickListener - OnActionClickListener.

      • setViewToMove

        public SnackProgressBarManager setViewToMove(android.view.View view)
        Pass the view (usually FloatingActionButton) to move up or down as SnackProgressBar is shown or dismissed.
        Parameters:
        view - View to be animated along with the SnackProgressBar.

      • setOverlayLayoutAlpha

        public SnackProgressBarManager setOverlayLayoutAlpha(float alpha)
        Set the transparency of the OverlayLayout which blocks user input.
        Parameters:
        alpha - Alpha between 0.0 to 1.0. Default = 0.8.

      • setProgress

        public SnackProgressBarManager setProgress(int progress)
        Set the progress for SnackProgressBar of TYPE_DETERMINATE. It will also update the progress text in %.
        Parameters:
        progress - Progress of the progressBar.

      • setAllowUserInput

        public SnackProgressBarManager setAllowUserInput(boolean allowUserInput)
        Set whether user input is allowed. Setting to TRUE will display the OverlayLayout which blocks user input.
        Parameters:
        allowUserInput - Whether to allow user input.

      • getSnackProgressBar

        public SnackProgressBar getSnackProgressBar(int id)
        Retrieve the SnackProgressBar that was previously added.
        Parameters:
        id - id of the SnackProgressBar contained in SnackProgressBarManager.
        Returns:
        SnackProgressBar

      • getLastShowing

        public SnackProgressBar getLastShowing()
        Retrieve the SnackProgressBar that is currently showing.
        Returns:
        SnackProgressBar that is currently showing. Return null if nothing is showing.
